body.p:
Mrs Johnsons
Frankfort Octo 9 1863
Govr. T. E. Bramlette

My situation is such that my room must be kept warm otherwise, my suffering is aggrevated, The family are out of Coal & wood & wood that can be perchased is green & will not keep me from suffering -- I dont wish you to deprive yourself. But if you could spare me 20- bushels of coal it would be a great accomodation -- I am informed by Alex Robinson it is the only chance to keep my Rheumatic bones quiet, I will pay for it or on the first opportunity
